100.description: The primary color used on the background of the app.

200.description: The alternative background color used for the app background.

100.description: The main color for used on surfaces, such as Cards or Side Panels.

200.description: The alternative background color used on surfaces that sit on top of some other UI elements.

300.description: The strong background color used on surfaces.

400.description: The stronger background color used on surfaces.

500.description: The strongest background color used on surfaces.

100.description: The muted primary primary color.

500.description: The strong color used on backgrounds meant to contrast against a parent background.

600.description: The strong color used on backgrounds meant to contrast against a parent background.

100.description: The muted background color used to inform success.

500.description: The strong background color used to inform success.

600.description: The stronger background color used to inform success.

default.description: The primary background color used to inform success.

100.description: The muted background color used to indicate a warning.

400.description: The default background color used to indicate a warning.

500.description: The strong background color used to indicate a warning.

600.description: The stronger background color used to indicate a warning.

100.description: The muted background color used to indicate danger, such as an error.

500.description: The default background color used to indicate danger, such as an error.

600.description: The strong background color used to indicate danger, such as an error.

700.description: The stronger background color used to indicate danger, such as an error.

400.description: The default background color used to contrast against the app or surface background.

500.description: The strong background color used to contrast against the app or surface background.

100.description: The forground color of contrast backgrounds.
Constants do not apply semantic meaning to the color.

500.description: Constants do not apply semantic meaning to the color.

white.description: Constants do not apply semantic meaning to the color.

black.description: Constants do not apply semantic meaning to the color.

overlay.description: Color used for overlay backgrounds, such as the Modal or Bottom Sheet.

translucent.description: Color used on overlay elements, such as Tooltip.

100.description: Foreground colors on dark backgrounds

300.description: The default foreground color, shared between all foreground elements

400.description: The strong foreground color, shared between all foreground elements

500.description: The stronger foreground color, shared between all foreground elements

100.description: The disabled foreground color, shared between all foreground elements

300.description: The hint foreground color, shared between all foreground elements.

100.description: The foreground color used on primary backgrounds

400.description: The text color used on branded, selected, or link text.

100.description: The foreground color used on top of critical background colors.

500.description: Text informs danger

100.description: The foreground color used on top of positive background colors.

500.description: The foreground color used on top of positive background colors.

400.description: The foreground color used on top of caution background colors.

500.description: The foreground color used on top of strong caution backgrounds.

300.description: The default text color, such as Body Text.

400.description: The strong text color, such as Headings.

500.description: The stronger text color, such as Headings on muted backgrounds.

100.description: The disabled text color.

300.description: The strong color used on backgrounds meant to contrast against a parent background.

100.description: The color used on text to contrast against backgrounds.

400.description: The primaryed text color, used in Links.

500.description: The critical text color, mean to imply danger.

400.description: The critical text color, mean to imply danger.

500.description: The critical text color, mean to imply danger.

200.description: The default color used on icons.

500.description: The strong color used on icons.

600.description: The disabled color used on icons.

500.description: The critical icon color, meant to imply danger.

400.description: The caution icon color, meant to imply a warning.

500.description: The positive icon color, meant to imply success.

100.description: The color used on icons to contrast against backgrounds.
Disabled border color for inputs.

500.description: strong border color for inputs.

caution.description: The caution border color, mean to imply a warning.

critical.description: The critical border color, mean to imply danger.

container.description: The border color used on containers, such as Cards or Side Panels

divider.description: The border color used on dividers that separate sections or elements from one another

600.description: The color used for the shadows in Depth.

1.description: Color used in the first Depth shadow

2.description: Color used in second Depth shadow
